Job Title: Senior Project Manager

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
Credit Acceptance is proud to be an award-winning company with local and national workplace recognition in multiple categories! Our world-class culture is shaped by dedicated Team Members who share a drive to succeed as professionals and together as a company. A great product, amazing people and our stable financial history have made us one of the largest used car finance companies nationally.

Our Support teams work with multiple departments in a dynamic environment that promotes flexibility and autonomy, while offering the opportunity to collaborate with a diverse group of professionals. We work to comply with our company standards, exceed customer expectations and drive our Great Place to Work culture. Through the consistent delivery of quality services and understanding the needs of our business, we develop innovative improvements as we strive towards our company’s Big, Hairy, Audacious Goals!

As a Senior Manager you will be responsible for overseeing a team of Project Manager Associates and Project Managers responsible for executing strategic projects. You will provide support and coaching to team members as they evaluate, execute, and finalize each project. You will also be responsible for applying the concepts of organizational health to develop and maintain a healthy, effective team. You will be expected to build strong relationships with other leaders in the organization and continuously expand their own knowledge of our business.

Outcomes and Activities: 

Apply organizational health to create and maintain a productive team able to deliver on-time, value-add projects to the organizationAssist in developing and improving PMO processes and toolsAssess and improve the team by reference to the organizational health dimensionsProvide direction, leadership and mentoring to PMO team membersEstablish measurable team and individual objectives that are aligned with business and organizational goalsEnsure staff has resources, skillsets and tools necessary to accomplish mission by continuously identifying educational and training opportunitiesCollaborate with Key Stakeholders to ensure project outcomes meet or exceed expectations in terms of scope, timeliness and qualityDevelop and maintain productive working relationships with project sponsors and teamsServe as a subject matter expert within the organization for project management knowledge areas and work with Leadership to develop and update Project Management methodology and tools for the organizationLead the capacity planning activity to manage resource needs for the portfolio

Competencies: The following items detail how you will be successful in this role.

Facilitation Techniques: Organize, support and/or conduct workshops, meetings, presentations specific to the objectives of each, problem to be solve, and needs of the audience.Cost Management: Performing the work required to support development of estimates, tracking and controlling costs to project can be completed within budget. Overseeing the work necessary to purchase products and/or services needed from outside the project team.Impact Analysis: Understand the rationale behind and how changes impact the enterprise and/or applications and across the technical ecosystem.Risk Management: Conducting risk management planning, identification, analysis, response planning, and controlling risk on a project.Schedule Management: Performing the work required to manage the completion of the project on time.

Requirements:

Bachelor’s Degree3+ years tenure at Credit Acceptance with one year in a Manager role (if candidate is internal)7+ years of project management experience or PMO experience2+ years of PMO or other department management experienceExperience with IT methodologies and processes (including Agile)Experience with Business Process Evaluation and Improvement (including BPMN)Working knowledge of Microsoft Project, Visio, Office and SharePointUnderstand and apply the concepts of project, program and portfolio management, prioritization, resource management, and change management, and be able to teach these concepts to othersCommunicate in a clear and concise manner to audiences at all levels of the organization and handle difficult conversations professionallyBe Proactive, Urgent, Assertive, Organized, Decisive, Self-driven, Ambitious, Intelligent, and Receptive to Feedback

Preferred Experience:

Bachelor’s Degree in business or ITMaster’s Degree1+ years of program management experienceExperience in financial services sector (loan servicing or loan origination organizations)

Targeted Compensation: $123,000 - $133,000 base salary + an annual bonus plan

This position is not currently open to individuals who require sponsorship now or in the future to work legally for Credit Acceptance, such as H-1b/ H-4 or F-1 OPT visa holders.

#zip

Benefits

Excellent benefits package that includes 401(K) match, adoption assistance, parental leave, tuition reimbursement, comprehensive medical/ dental/vision and many nonstandard benefits that make us a Great Place to Work 

Our Company Values:

To be successful in this role, Team Members need to be:

Positive by maintaining resiliency and focusing on solutionsRespectful by collaborating and actively listeningInsightful by cultivating innovation, accumulating business and role specific knowledge, demonstrating self-awareness and making quality decisionsDirect by effectively communicating and conveying courageEarnest by taking accountability, applying feedback and effectively planning and priority setting

Expectations:

Remain compliant with our policies processes and legal guidelinesAll other duties as assignedAttendance as required by department 

Advice!

We understand that your career search may look different than others. Our hiring team wants to make sure that this would be a fit not just for us, but for you long term. If you are actively looking or starting to explore new opportunities, send us your application!

P.S.

We have great details around our stats, success, history and more. We’re proud of our culture and are happy to share why – let’s talk!

Required degrees must have been earned at institutions of Higher Education which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent.

Credit Acceptance is dedicated to providing a safe and inclusive working environment for all. As part of our Culture of Compliance, we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and value our culturally diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of the person’s age, race, color, religion, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status, criminal history, or any other legally protected characteristic.

California Residents: Please click here for the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) notice regarding the personal information Credit Acceptance may collect from you.

Play the video below to learn more about our Company culture.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
